ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.service

Class TreeManagerService

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.service.TreeManagerService

  • @Service
public class TreeManagerService
extends java.lang.Object
    This service class contains all main functionalities of the TreeManager.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TreeManagerService(VersionManager vm)
      The TreeManagerService constructor verifies which version has been selected by the user, finds the TreeManager associated to that version and sets the class's TreeManager as that one for users to edit attributes on that TreeManager.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TreeManagerService

        public TreeManagerService(VersionManager vm)
        The TreeManagerService constructor verifies which version has been selected by the user, finds the TreeManager associated to that version and sets the class's TreeManager as that one for users to edit attributes on that TreeManager.
        Parameters:
        vm - VersionManager of the application

    • Method Detail

      • checkIfEditable

        public void checkIfEditable(TreeManager tm)
                     throws InvalidInputException
        This method checks if the tree manager is editable to the user. Only the latest non-forecasted version is editable.
        Parameters:
        tm - current version that is selected
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - input exception handling

      • refreshSelectedTmAndCheckIfEditable

        public void refreshSelectedTmAndCheckIfEditable()
                                         throws InvalidInputException
        This method refreshes TreeLog to the selected version and checks if it is editable.
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException

      • refreshSelectedTM

        public void refreshSelectedTM()
        This method only refreshes selected version

      • createTree

        public Tree createTree(java.lang.String ownerName,
                       java.lang.String species,
                       double height,
                       double diameter,
                       int age,
                       Location location,
                       Municipality municipality,
                       Tree.LandUse land)
                throws InvalidInputException
        This method creates a tree with the following attributes
        Parameters:
        ownerName - Owner's name
        species - Species of the tree
        height - Height of the tree in meters
        diameter - Diameter of the tree canopy in meters
        age - Age of the tree
        location - Location of the tree
        municipality - Municipality where the tree is located
        land - Land use of the tree (Residential or non-residential)
        Returns:
        returns tree created
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - handles input exception error

        adds municipality
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException

      • moveTree

        public void moveTree(Tree tree,
                     double newLatitude,
                     double newLongitude)
              throws InvalidInputException
        This feature is for users to move a tree. They choose a tree and input its new latitude and longitude coordinates and if all inputs our correct, the tree will have this new location.
        Parameters:
        tree -
        newLatitude -
        newLongitude -
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException

      • getLocationByCoordinates

        public Location getLocationByCoordinates(double lati,
                                         double longi)
                                  throws InvalidInputException
        This method gets the location given the coordinates. If it does not exist it creates a new location.
        Parameters:
        lati - latitude of location
        longi - longitude of location
        Returns:
        returns the location with the longitude and coordinates given
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException

                                        throws InvalidInputException
        This method lists all the trees by species
        Parameters:
        species - desired species type
        Returns:
        returns all the trees belonging to desired species type
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - returns error if species name is null, empty or does not exist currently in TreeLog

      • listTreesByLandUse

                                        throws InvalidInputException
        This method lists all the trees pertaining to a certain land use
        Parameters:
        landUse - desired land use
        Returns:
        returns a list of all the trees with this land use
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - returns error if desired land use does not currently exist in TreeLog

        Returns:

      • updateTreeData

        public void updateTreeData(Tree tree,
                           double newHeight,
                           double newDiameter,
                           int newAge,
                           java.lang.String newOwnerName,
                           java.lang.String newSpecies,
                           Tree.LandUse newLandUse,
                           Municipality newMunicipality)
                    throws InvalidInputException
        The feature updateTreeData is intended for the user to be able to correct tree information for better accuracy. The attributes of the tree a user can update does not affect the tree’s physical location (use moveTree for that).
        Parameters:
        tree - tree to update
        newHeight -
        newDiameter -
        newAge -
        newOwnerName -
        newSpecies -
        newLandUse -
        newMunicipality -
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException

        municipality - desired municipality
        Returns:
        returns a list of the trees belonging to this municipality
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException

      • listTreesByStatus

        public java.util.List<Tree> listTreesByStatus(Tree.Status status)
                                       throws InvalidInputException
        This method lists all the trees pertaining to a certain status
        Parameters:
        status - status of the tree (planted, to be cut-down, cut-down, diseased)
        Returns:
        returns all the trees with the desired status
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - input error is thrown if status is null or status does not currently exist in TreeLog

        Returns:
        UserType with that name if found, or null if it doesn't exist
